greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal value of the ternary Champernowne constant.
comment: The first 99 digits form a prime. - _Jonathan Vos Post_, Nov 11 2004
This constant is 3-normal. - _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 06 2015
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ternary Champernowne Constant
program: (PARI) A077771(b=3,t=1.,s=b)={sum(n=1, default(realprecision)*2.303\log(b)+1, n<s||s*=b; n*t/=s)} \\ First optional arg allows to get C[b] for other bases. - _M. F. Hasler_, Oct 25 2019
xref: Cf. A030190, A066716, A066717: binary digits, decimals and continued fraction of the binary Champernowne constant; A033307: decimal Champernowne constant.
results.author: _Eric W. Weisstein_, Nov 15 2002
